notes.professionalServiceHours: Professional service hours are versatile, blended hours bundled within your subscription plan. They encompass expertise from diverse specialists, including business analysts, architects, lead automation engineers, DevOps (System Engineers), and performance engineers. These multi-functional hours cater to KubeRocketCI installation, configuration, integration, customization, feature implementation, updates, and use case implementation. They empower you to leverage a range of expertise for various aspects of optimizing and enhancing your KubeRocketCI experience.

notes.disclaimer: The values presented in the table are provided for reference purposes only and are subject to change based on the final scope of the work. Please note that these figures serve as estimates and may be adjusted accordingly as the project details are finalized.

items.minimum: Deploy Platform with Minimum Components in the existing Kubernetes Cluster: CI/CD, integration with existing SonarQube, Repository Manager, Container Registry
items.full: Deploy Platform in an empty AWS Account, including components: Infrastructure, CI/CD, SSO integration, SonarQube, DependencyTrack, Nexus Repository, DefectDojo, Logging, Monitoring, Docker registry, Observability
items.observability: Traceability and Observability customization: Storage backend configuration, performance tunning
items.monitoring: Monitoring stack customization: Custom Dashboards, Alerts, Notifications
items.logging: Logging stack customization: Custom filters and processing for fluent-bit, logs rotation policy tunning
items.sonarqube: SonarQube Quality Gate and Quality Profile configuration
items.security: Security (SAST/SCA) report analysis per single codebase

items.onboard: Onboard new Framework or Build tool with CI Pipelines: Implement KubeRocketCI standard CI Pipeline steps (build, test, lint, push)
items.template: Marketplace Template Development: Create new Template, Implement KubeRocketCI standard CI Pipeline steps (build, test, lint, push)
